Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Hotspot Targeting in Deep Brain Stimulation for Parkinson’s Disease

Trial_Design.evidence: Patients were randomised to DBS under general or local anaesthesia.

Participants.evidence: PD patients undergoing bilateral STN DBS between May 2015 and March 2019.

Intervention.evidence: Patients were randomised to DBS under general or local anaesthesia.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to validate and refine a previously defined hotspot for dorsolateral STN targeting in deep brain stimulation (DBS) for Parkinson’s disease (PD).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was hemibody improvement on the Movement Disorder Society–Unified Parkinson’s Disease Rating Scale motor examination (MDS-UPDRS ME) at 6 months post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 109 patients were randomised.

Number_Analysed.evidence: 106 were analysed using a per-protocol approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Poor responders showed a 13% improvement compared to -8% in historical controls (p=0.044).
